model

Class Civilization

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Civilization

  • public class Civilization
extends java.lang.Object
    Coordinator for the management of settlers. This class is a singleton.
    Author:
    Christopher Chapline, James Fagan, Emily Leones, Michelle Yung

      • setMap

        public void setMap(Map m)

      • getInstance

        public static Civilization getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance of this class
        Returns:
        The Civilization instance

      • addTaskToQueue

        public void addTaskToQueue(Task task)
        Adds a task to the job queue. Jobs will be periodically pulled off the job queue by units in the civilization and the units will perform the jobs as long as they are able.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to the add to the job queue

      • isAvailableTask

        public boolean isAvailableTask()
        Determines if there is an available task on the job queue
        Returns:
        True if there is a task on the job queue, false otherwise.

      • getNextTask

        public Task getNextTask()
        Pulls a job from the job queue and returns it.
        Returns:
        The next job at the top of the job queue. If no job is available, null is returned.

      • addUnit

        public void addUnit(Unit unit)
        Adds a unit to the list of maintined units.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to add to the list

      • removeUnit

        public boolean removeUnit(Unit unit)
        Removes the specified unit from the list of units. Occurs in the instance of unit death.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to remove
        Returns:
        True if the unit was removed from the list.

      • addStructure

        public void addStructure(AbstractStructure structure)
        Adds a structure to the list of structures in this civilization.
        Parameters:
        structure - The structure to add

      • pollResource

        public int pollResource(ResourceType resourceType,
               int desiredResourceAmount)
        Attempts to remove a certain amount of a resource from the global store. If there is enough, the desired amount will be returned. Otherwise, the amount currently in the stores will be returned and the global store will be set to 0.
        Parameters:
        desiredResourceAmount - The amount of a resource you would like to remove from the global store.
        resourceType - The resource you would like to retrieve from the global store
        Returns:
        The desired amount if it is available, or all available resource if the desired amount could not be met.
